results.title: The Animals of Farthing Wood
results.creator_credit: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

results.title: From copse to quarry
results.creator_credit: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animals of Farthing Wood”.
Another dazzling animated adventure for the animals of Farthing Wood. “Are you telling me that you don’t want to go on to White Deer Park?” asks Badger of the tiny fieldmice who have decided not to continue on the journey to the nature reserve. The animals are less than half way through their journey but already their fearless leader, Fox is missing, presumed drowned. It’s no surprise that morale among the animals is at an all-time low. So much as everyone loves and trusts Badger, it will need all of his strength and authority to keep the animals together, when even he must secretly doubt whether they will ever reach their destination safely… and if they do make it, will the cost have been too high?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU

results.title: Ice society
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
This series examines the great southern continent and man’s connection with it. This particular film, which is episode four, looks at the intriguing adaptations, both physical and behavioural, of plant and wildlife in the inhospitable surroundings of the Antarctic.

results.title: Out of sight, out of mind
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Looks at the history of Antarctic exploration, incorporating still photographs and rare archival film. Includes footage of the expeditions of Scott, Amundsen and Shackleton and Admiral Byrd’s flight to the South Pole, with Sir Edmund Hillary’s tractor journey to the pole.

results.title: The Water of life
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
The Antarctic continent is a unique natural laboratory for the study of simple life forms, and of physical and behavioural adaptations to inhospitable surroundings. The ocean surrounding Antarctica also has the world’s greatest untrapped food supply. The film asks whether controlled exploitation and development can take place without upsetting the delicate balance of nature.

results.title: Blowing hot and cold
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Provides statistics on some aspects of the Antarctic continent such as the size of the landmass as compared to Australia and the types of weather conditions experienced. Also presents the latest scientific evidence on the effect of the Antarctic ice mass on world climate. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Selling solidarity = Australian unionism in the '90's
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Australia has always had a strong union heritage. Peter Robson, (National President of the CPSU), and Peter Sams, (Secretary of the NSW Labour Council, discuss reasons for the rapidly declining membership and the ACTU’s multi-million dollar plan to recruit a new generation of workers.

results.title: Diplomacy and deceit
results.creator_credit: Per-Eric Hawthorn, Peter Morgan and Independent Television News (GB)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
Provides students with the inside story of how the Western powers failed to stop the conflict in the Balkans. Key political figures reveal what happened behind the scenes. It examines the continuing communist influence in what was once an Eastern Bloc country, the failure of diplomacy to end the conflict and the absence of Western military intervention.
